decks.notes: This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly deploying efficient creatures like Novice Inspector and Thraben Inspector, while leveraging powerful cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Venerated Loxodon to disrupt the opponent's game plan. With the ability to quickly apply pressure and close out games with cards like Gleeful Demolition and Resolute Reinforcements, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its aggressive strategy. Additionally, the inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a Companion provides additional utility and consistency to the deck's game plan.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage. It utilizes a mix of planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Narset, Parter of Veils, along with board wipes like Supreme Verdict to control the battlefield. The inclusion of Kaheera as a companion provides additional value and synergizes well with the deck's creature base. The land base is designed to support both the white and blue requirements of the deck, while cards like Memory Deluge and Three Steps Ahead help to ensure the player has the right answers at the right time.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by using the Fires of Invention enchantment to cast spells for free and limit the opponent's options with cards like Leyline Binding and Temporary Lockdown. The deck also includes a variety of powerful creatures and lands to provide versatility and adaptability in different situations. With Keruga, the Macrosage as a companion, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent while maintaining board control and card advantage. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to utilize control elements and powerful spells to establish dominance in the game.

This deck focuses on aggressive play using human creature cards, with a particular emphasis on boosting each other's strength and abilities. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent quickly with a consistent stream of threats that can quickly build up in power. The deck includes a mix of low-cost creatures and spells to maintain pressure on the opponent. The land base is optimized to ensure consistent mana production for the aggressive strategy to succeed. Overall, the deck aims to outpace and overpower the opponent in a fast-paced match.

This deck focuses on utilizing control elements to disrupt the opponent's strategy while gradually building up a board presence. The key strategy involves using cards like March of Otherworldly Light and Get Lost to control the board, while also utilizing cards like Carrot Cake and Caretaker's Talent for resource advantage. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Elspeth, Sun's Champion and The Wandering Emperor to close out the game. Additionally, the inclusion of Kaheera, the Orphanguard as a companion adds additional synergy and versatility to the deck.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on playing fast and aggressively, using low-cost creatures and burn spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent. The deck includes cards like Emberheart Challenger, Monastery Swiftspear, and Slickshot Show-Off to put pressure on the opponent early in the game. By playing cards like Ancestral Anger, Claim / Fame, and Kumano Faces Kakkazan, the deck aims to maximize damage output. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds extra value and flexibility to the deck. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and efficient aggression.
